definition: "silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
stumbling block/obstacle/someone who gets in your way

sentences.english: He spread a net for my feet and turned me back.
sentences.chinese: 他铺下网罗，绊我的脚，使我转回。

sentences.english: I tripped over the leg that stuck out.
sentences.chinese: 我被什么人伸出腿绊了一跤。

sentences.english: She nearly fell down by stumbling over my stretched leg.
sentences.chinese: 她绊在我伸出的腿上，险些跌倒。

sentences.english: The oaf stumbled over the bucket, spilling all the water.
sentences.chinese: 那个笨手笨脚的人绊到了木桶，把水全给泼了。

sentences.english: When Mickey trips on the stairs of his house, gravity hauls him down.
sentences.chinese: 米奇在他家的楼梯上被绊到的时候，重力会把它拉倒。

sentences.english: Suddenly, I was tumbled, fell on the ground, but without any pain. I scrabbled to get up, and kept running.
sentences.chinese: 忽地绊了一跤，扑了一下倒在地上，却也不觉得疼。

sentences.english: It was difficult to keep a straight face when he fell over the dog.
sentences.chinese: 当他绊着狗摔了一跤时，大家很难扳着脸不笑。

sentences.english: The old man tripped over a stone.
He knows that he could climb the stairs without stumbling once.
sentences.chinese: 他知道自己能走上楼梯，绝不会绊着脚。

sentences.english: She was near running, making me take quick tripping steps to keep pace.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎是在跑，我得跌跌绊绊迈着快步才能跟上。

sentences.english: She was near running, making me take quick tripping steps to keep pace.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎是在跑，我得跌跌绊绊迈着快步才能跟上。

sentences.english: The child tripped and tumbled down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 孩子绊了一下，从楼梯上滚了下去。

sentences.english: We hadn't gone too far when my husband's mule stumbled.
sentences.chinese: 走了不多远，我丈夫的驴绊了一跤。

sentences.english: Whoever flatters his neighbor is spreading a net for his feet.
sentences.chinese: 谄媚邻舍的，就是设网罗绊他的脚。

sentences.english: The design of concise, double-color shoes after careful strappy more add flavor of leg ministry line.
sentences.chinese: 双色鞋的设计简洁，细致的后绊带更添腿部线条韵味。

definition: to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
to fall flat on one's face
to sprain (one's ankle)/see 崴子[wai3 zi5]
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to fall flat on one's face (vulgar)
to fall flat on one's face/(martial arts) pouncing and falling (i.e. all kinds of moves)
to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]
